Scenario: You see a woman spanking her child with a spatula for getting bad grades in school.
Moral Explanation: Physical punishment for academic performance is generally considered morally unacceptable.

Scenario: I was supposed to go see my father before he died. He was ill and my mother was supposed to come into town so we could see him. She didn't come, so we never made it before he passed away.
Moral Explanation: Failing to visit a dying parent is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X stepped in when a friend at a pub was getting assaulted for being dark skinned.
Moral Explanation: Stepping in to protect a friend from assault based on their skin color is highly morally acceptable.

Scenario: Gave a beggar a five-dollar bill at Christmas time
Moral Explanation: Generous act of kindness during the holiday season.

Scenario: You are the safety officer in charge of a fun park. One of the metal arms of the ferris wheel suddenly breaks because of a structural defect. Four people are stranded in a cabin 80 metres up in the air. Another person is in a cabin just a few metres from ground level and is able to get off alone. The whole structure is falling down.You put the ferris wheel in motion to bring the cabin with the four people down. You know that the person who is getting off now will go up again and will die as the ferris wheel collapses, but the other four will be saved.
Moral Explanation: Saving four lives outweighs sacrificing one in this emergency situation.

Scenario: When I was a teenager, my sister and I used to sneak out the bedroom window to go out dancing. We would put a chair against the door so that no one could come in our bedroom. A couple of times we got caught.
Moral Explanation: Slightly morally acceptable as it involves disobedience but not harmful actions.

Scenario: Person X ordered pizza while at their friend's farewell party.
Moral Explanation: Slightly acceptable as it may disrupt the farewell party atmosphere.

Scenario: It is evening. A friend calls you saying that he has a terrible migraine headache. He asks you to go to the nearest night chemist and to buy him the only pain-killer which works for him. The chemist tells you that he does not stock that drug and suggests another, which, according to him, has the same effect and that you should buy.You buy the migraine drug that the chemist suggests. You make your friend take it without showing him the box. He will think he is taking the one he asked for.
Moral Explanation: Deceptive, but not extremely harmful or unethical.

Scenario: Took a friend out for a beer to celebrate his promotion
Moral Explanation: Celebrating a friend's achievement is morally acceptable and a common social practice.

Scenario: Fires teargas into a crowd of civilians.
Moral Explanation: Using teargas on civilians is morally unacceptable and can cause harm.

Scenario: Complimented coworkers on their clothing and appearance
Moral Explanation: Complimenting coworkers on their clothing and appearance is generally morally acceptable.

Scenario: I was in a relationship with my best friend's cousin. She was really beautiful, but as time went on I became less attracted to her. I tried to tell her I didn't really want to see her anymore and she flipped out.
Moral Explanation: Breaking up is acceptable, but the way it was handled could have been better.

Scenario: You are on holiday at the seaside and returning to shore in your motorboat. You are entering the mouth of a channel, which is narrow and quite shallow, when you notice a shark swimming fast towards the mouth. At the end of the channel is a swimmer, who is calmly bathing. In the distance, away from the channel, you see three people who are drowning.You turn quickly out of the channel, leaving the mouth free. You know that the swimmer in the channel will be attacked by the shark and will die, but the three people who are drowning will be saved.
Moral Explanation: Saving three lives outweighs sacrificing one.

Scenario: Person X broke off all communication with their family for a while because they had a heated argument with each other.
Moral Explanation: Breaking off communication is not ideal, but understandable in heated arguments.

Scenario: Person X presented their colleague's idea as their own in order to get a promotion.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable to take credit for someone else's work.

Scenario: You see an employee joking with competitors about how bad his company did last year.
Moral Explanation: It is highly morally unacceptable as it shows disloyalty and lack of professionalism.

Scenario: Someone posts on social media bragging about making out with multiple strangers the night before
Moral Explanation: Promoting risky behavior and disrespecting personal boundaries.

Scenario: You see a girl shooting geese repeatedly with a pellet gun out in the woods.
Moral Explanation: Harming animals for sport is generally considered morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a family eating the carcass of their pet dog that had been run over.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable to eat a pet dog's carcass.

Scenario: Person X stole the collection tin of a blind beggar on the street.
Moral Explanation: Stealing from a blind beggar is absolutely unacceptable and morally wrong.

Scenario: Refused to hold the door for a man in a wheelchair
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable to refuse holding the door for a man in a wheelchair.

Scenario: Spent time voluntarily tutoring disadvantaged students
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as it involves voluntary help to disadvantaged students.

Scenario: Person X saw a homeless person in the rain, so they gave the person their jacket and umbrella, plus $20 for a hot meal
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable act of compassion and generosity.

Scenario: For a while I was a security officer at a bank. One day I was walking by the front door when I saw a fifty-dollar bill. I was tempted to take the money but instead I reported it to the manager.
Moral Explanation: Reporting the found money shows honesty and integrity.

Scenario: Heckled a woman speaking on human rights
Moral Explanation: Heckling someone speaking on human rights is morally unacceptable and disrespectful.

Scenario: Criticized an old woman for being too slow
Moral Explanation: Criticizing an old woman for being slow is disrespectful and morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X took public transport so their sister could use their car to get to work safely.
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as it prioritizes safety and helps someone in need.

Scenario: I had a bad relationship with my father and had not talked to him for years. He had left my mother. When my mother died I gathered the strength to call him and tell him that she died and that I loved him.
Moral Explanation: Showing forgiveness and love towards a estranged parent after the death of a loved one.

Scenario: My husband ran a business and I worked in his shop. Once a rather unsavory character came in and handed my husband something. So, I looked through my husband's wallet to see what the man gave him.
Moral Explanation: Invasion of privacy, but not extremely morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You are the head of a group of five travellers who are exploring the remote regions of South America. During the trip, you inadvertently camp in the sacred cemetery of a local tribe. The members of the tribe capture you and condemn you all to death. After some negotiation, they propose a possible alternative in the form of a human sacrifice that will pacify their god who has been offended.You accept the tribe’s proposal, and during the ceremony, you kill one of the travellers in the group. This person will die, but you and the other four travellers’ lives will be spared.
Moral Explanation: Killing an innocent person for personal gain is absolutely unacceptable.

Scenario: Rescued an injured kitten from a tree
Moral Explanation: Rescuing an injured kitten is morally acceptable and compassionate.

Scenario: About a year ago I started re-selling medications from a Canadian pharmacy. I helped a great deal of elderly people so that they didn't have to pay exorbitant amounts for their medications that they needed.
Moral Explanation: Helping elderly people access affordable medications outweighs legal concerns.

Scenario: I was at the pharmacy buying something and I noticed a man who was sitting outside selling trinkets. He was homeless and it was freezing out. So I went next door to a store and bought him some food and new clothes.
Moral Explanation: Showing compassion and helping someone in need is morally acceptable.

Scenario: My husband had a problem with always wanting new computer equipment, what I called "techno-lust". It was a really huge financial problem, and I told him he had to go on a 5-year plan to financially police himself or I would divorce him. He has greatly improved.
Moral Explanation: Husband's improvement and financial responsibility outweigh the ultimatum given by the spouse.

Scenario: Took the neighbor's newspaper
Moral Explanation: Stealing is generally considered morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see someone cheating in a card game while playing with a group of strangers.
Moral Explanation: Cheating is absolutely unacceptable and goes against fair play and honesty.

Scenario: Person X did really well at the quiz night.
Moral Explanation: Doing well at a quiz night is morally neutral and does not have a significant impact on others.

Scenario: Sang at a prison in order to entertain the inmates
Moral Explanation: Entertaining inmates can provide a positive impact on their well-being and rehabilitation.

Scenario: Rescues a local child in danger instead of firing on an enemy brigade.
Moral Explanation: Rescuing a child is highly morally acceptable and prioritizing human life over enemy combatants.

Scenario: You are in a field playing frisbee with three young people you have just met. Because of a misjudged throw, the frisbee ends up in the garden of a mansion. You decide to climb the wall to look for it. Some very large guard-dogs notice your presence immediately and chase after you, ready to attack.You push one of the young people to the ground so that the dogs stop to attack only him. You know that he will die, but you, and the other two, will be able to escape.
Moral Explanation: Pushing someone to their death is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X worked on a campaign to release wrongfully convicted prisoners.
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as it aims to correct injustice and help innocent individuals.

Scenario: Gave his coat to someone when it was cold
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable act of kindness in a cold situation.

Scenario: Kicked a stray cat to get it to leave his yard
Moral Explanation: Kicking a stray cat is cruel and unnecessary.

Scenario: Tricked a stay at home mom into donating to a fake charity
Moral Explanation: Exploiting someone's trust and goodwill is absolutely unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X volunteers at a dog refuge, walking the dogs and cleaning their kennels once a week.
Moral Explanation: Highly morally acceptable as it involves volunteering to help animals in need.

Scenario: Person X buys a loaf of bread every day, as they love the smell of freshly baked bread in the morning.
Moral Explanation: Neutral, as it is a personal preference and does not harm others.

Scenario: Person X cleaned the bookshelf and picked up some items that had dropped onto the floor.
Moral Explanation: Cleaning and organizing is a morally acceptable action.

Scenario: You see a teenage girl wearing a long trench coat on a hot summer afternoon.
Moral Explanation: Unusual but not morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a pastor banning his congregants from wearing bright colors in the church.
Moral Explanation: Restricting personal expression is morally questionable, but not extremely unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X always pays off their debts first before buying things for themselves.
Moral Explanation: Responsible and ethical behavior, prioritizing financial obligations over personal desires.

Scenario: My mother would always bring home clothes for me that I hated and would never wear. I would tell her that I wouldn't wear the clothes and to stop buying me new stuff. She would get really mad at me.
Moral Explanation: It is somewhat morally unacceptable for the mother to continue buying clothes the person dislikes.

Scenario: Lent money to a friend in a financial crisis
Moral Explanation: Helping a friend in need is morally acceptable and shows compassion.

Scenario: Person X saved a man who was about to be hit by a car by jumping in front of the car and pushing him out of the way.
Moral Explanation: Saving someone's life is morally commendable and justifiable.

Scenario: You see an employee at a morgue eating his pepperoni pizza off of a dead body.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable and morally repugnant behavior.

Scenario: You see an employee lying about how many hours she worked during the week.
Moral Explanation: Lying about work hours is dishonest and unethical, negatively impacting trust and fairness.

Scenario: Pushed into the front of a line at a theater
Moral Explanation: Pushing in line is rude and disrespectful to others.

Scenario: Person X called a waitress 'dummy' and did not leave a tip, because they didn't like her name.
Moral Explanation: It is highly morally unacceptable to insult someone and withhold a tip based on their name.

Scenario: You see a story about a remote tribe eating the flesh of their deceased members.
Moral Explanation: Cultural relativism, but still morally questionable due to potential harm.

Scenario: Someone brags on social media about drinking excessively to the point of vomiting
Moral Explanation: Glorifying excessive drinking and its negative consequences is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Didn't leave a tip at the restaurant
Moral Explanation: Leaving no tip is generally considered rude and disrespectful to the service staff.

Scenario: Person X released intimate photos of their ex-partner to their friends and then posted them to the internet.
Moral Explanation: This scenario is absolutely unacceptable as it violates the ex-partner's privacy and consent.

Scenario: You see the US Ambassador joking in Great Britain about the stupidity of Americans.
Moral Explanation: Disrespectful and offensive behavior by a representative of a country.

Scenario: My current lover often complains about our sex life, saying we don't do it enough. Sometimes I will watch online porn and masturbate instead. Sometimes, I feel like it's just easier and more fun to do that.
Moral Explanation: Lack of communication and prioritizing personal pleasure over partner's needs.

Scenario: Had a welcoming party for some new neighbors
Moral Explanation: Welcoming new neighbors is a kind and considerate gesture.

Scenario: You are the commander of a Russian military submarine on a mission. You have been trapped for days at the bottom of the Pacific Ocean without energy. You have already asked for help several times, but there are no ships or submarines in the nearby waters and help is taking time to arrive. There are six crew members with you on board and your food supplies are getting low.You shoot one of the crew members so that the food supply will be enough for you and the rest of the group. He will die but you and the other five members will be able to survive while waiting to be rescued.
Moral Explanation: Killing a crew member for personal survival is absolutely unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a boy turning up the TV as his father talks about his military service.
Moral Explanation: Moderately acceptable as it may indicate the boy's interest in his father's military service.

Scenario: I was working at a fast food restaurant and the policy was to throw away the excess food at the end of the night. Even if there was a large quantity of food left over you had to throw it away. Instead my friend and I would take home the extra food.
Moral Explanation: Minimizing food waste and benefiting individuals without causing harm.

Scenario: Person X left their long-term band as soon as an opportunity came up to play with a more successful band.
Moral Explanation: Moderately acceptable as it is a personal decision to pursue better opportunities.

Scenario: You are in charge of an expedition which is crossing the Sahara. A sand storm causes your jeep to swerve off the road and overturn in the middle of the desert. You know that the nearest oasis is a week’s walk away. There are eight of you and a very limited amount of water, which will not allow you all to survive the scorching heat.You shoot two people so that there will be enough water for you and the rest of the group. These two will die, but you and the other five will be able to survive.
Moral Explanation: Killing two people to save yourself and others is absolutely unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X was able to convince their boss that they were ready for a promotion at work.
Moral Explanation: It depends on the circumstances and the methods used to convince the boss.

Scenario: You see a woman getting hired only because her father is close friends with the boss.
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable as it promotes nepotism and unfairness in the workplace.

Scenario: Stole into a parking place while someone else was backing in
Moral Explanation: Stealing a parking place is considered rude and inconsiderate behavior.

Scenario: A few years ago, I was single and I went to see a friend of mine in the Bahamas. I was extremely attracted to a man I met there who was married. I danced as close to the fire as I could, but I did nothing.
Moral Explanation: Neutral, as no action was taken despite attraction to a married person.

Scenario: As I was backing out of a parking lot I bumped a parked car and left a minor dent. I didn't even feel the impact when I hit the car but it left a little bit of damage. I drove away without leaving a message or trying to contact the person.
Moral Explanation: Leaving the scene without taking responsibility is morally unacceptable and shows lack of empathy.

Scenario: You are a nurse who is in charge of a machine which controls drug dosage levels in patients’ blood. Because of a technical failure, the machine is supplying a lethal dose of the drug to four patients. Another patient, in a single room, is hooked up to the same machine and has not undergone any variation in dosage.Press the button to block the drug supply to the four patients. You know that the overdose of drug will be redirected to the patient in the single room, who will die, but the other four will be saved.
Moral Explanation: Saving four lives outweighs sacrificing one.

Scenario: Person X went to a fancy restaurant but couldn't pronounce the items on the menu.
Moral Explanation: Slight social embarrassment, but not morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Recently I was supposed to go to a meeting with a whole bunch of people who are not my friends, just acquaintances. I really didn't want to go. So I emailed the group saying that I had to work that day, when in reality I didn't.
Moral Explanation: Deceptive, but not extremely harmful or unethical.

Scenario: You are in the head office of your bank together with four other people. Suddenly, the director calls you because he has discovered a bomb in an office on the ground floor. He knows you are a bomb disposal expert and asks you to defuse it. You realise immediately that there is not enough time to evacuate the people in the bank before the bomb explodes.You throw the bomb into the basement where there is the security vault. You know that the explosion will kill the security guard in the vault, but you and the other four people will be saved.
Moral Explanation: Saving five lives at the cost of one is morally acceptable.

Scenario: You are driving your new and very expensive car along a narrow country road. On the edge of the road you see a person who has just fallen off their bicycle. This person has hit their head violently and asks you if you can accompany them to the nearest hospital. You realise that because of the fall the person is now covered with mud.You leave the injured person on the side of the road. You know that sooner or later somebody will pass by and, in this way, you will not dirty the leather seats in your new car.
Moral Explanation: Leaving an injured person in need of help for personal convenience is absolutely unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a boy placing a thumbtack sticking up on the chair of another student.
Moral Explanation: Harmful and intentionally malicious act towards another student.

Scenario: You see a man telling his girlfriend that she must convert to his religion.
Moral Explanation: Coercing someone to convert to a religion is morally unacceptable and violates personal autonomy.

Scenario: Ate all the food before anyone else could have any
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable to consume all the food without considering others.

Scenario: You see a man staying inside his home with the shades drawn on a rare sunny day.
Moral Explanation: It is somewhat morally unacceptable to stay inside with shades drawn on a rare sunny day.

Scenario: Accidentally wounds a young soldier when firing a warning shot.
Moral Explanation: Accidentally causing harm is morally wrong, but it was not intentional.

Scenario: Left food out for stray dogs
Moral Explanation: Showing compassion and care for stray animals is morally acceptable.

Scenario: Person X scratched their neighbor's expensive car with a key, as he always parked it at the front of PersonX's house.
Moral Explanation: Damaging someone's property out of revenge is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: The healthy carrier of a contagious and lethal disease is being held in quarantine in hospital. Suddenly the ventilation system breaks down and there is no longer a change of air in the room. The emergency system will shortly be activated and an internal window will be opened. This window opens into a ward in which five patients are being treated for various illnesses.You block the emergency system by pressing a button which will keep the window closed. You know that the healthy carrier will suffocate, but the five patients will be saved from mortal contagion.
Moral Explanation: Sacrificing one life to save five is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: You see a father requiring his son to become a commercial airline pilot like him.
Moral Explanation: Moderately acceptable as it limits the son's career choices but may also provide stability and shared passion.

Scenario: Someone yells at a server at a restaurant because their meal is late
Moral Explanation: Rudeness is not justified, but frustration is understandable.

Scenario: I said some bad things about this guy that I work with. He told me some secrets that I promised not to share, but I did anyway. He didn't find out but I was afraid if he did, he might do something crazy.
Moral Explanation: Breaking promises and spreading secrets is morally unacceptable.

Scenario: Person X punched a woman for wearing a hijab because PersonX thinks they should not be allowed in this country.
Moral Explanation: This scenario is absolutely unacceptable as it involves physical assault and discrimination.

Scenario: When I was a football coach, I was often involved with the moms of the kids on the team. There were many mothers that were attractive and made themselves available. I was very tempted to have sex with one mother who came on to me.
Moral Explanation: Engaging in sexual activities with a parent of a child under your care is highly unethical.

Scenario: Executes a squad of surrendering enemy troops.
Moral Explanation: Killing surrendering troops is a grave violation of moral principles and international laws.

Scenario: Refuses to fire into a crowd to stop an enemy combatant.
Moral Explanation: Refusing to fire into a crowd shows a high moral standard and respect for human life.

Scenario: Pulled his dog's tail
Moral Explanation: Cruel and abusive behavior towards an animal.

Scenario: Beat up someone smaller than him
Moral Explanation: Absolutely unacceptable to beat up someone smaller than him.
